WILLIAM KNOFF
ELECTRICAL ENGINEER & DATA SCIENTIST

Self-driven student passionate about continuous improvement through career and personal development.

Professional Summary

I am a self-driven student passionate about continuous improvement through career and personal development. With experience in electrical engineering principles, programming in C, C++, and Python, and circuit design and simulation using Altium, LTSpice, and HSPICE, I aim to leverage my skills to create innovative solutions. My practical experience includes working on various engineering projects such as solar-powered boat construction, motor controllers, and data science applications like stock prediction models.

Projects

Solar Powered Boat for Solar Splash® Competition | Present

• Constructing the electrical systems of a solar-powered boat.
• Designed battery configuration optimized for high-power sprint and long-distance endurance race.
• Built battery monitoring systems using Victron battery monitor and shunt resistor.
• Assembled solar charging circuit using solar panels and Genasun GV-boost controllers.
• Programmed VESC controller for brushless Alienpower motor to be compatible with RC and local potentiometer throttles.
• Programmed throttle with Alltrax motor controller for a 10kW axial gap DC brushed motor.

J1939 CAN Bus & Ignition Emulator for Electric Trucks | August 2024

• Emulates the CAN traces of two different in-development electric trucks.
• Built Python app on a Raspberry Pi with a GUI (Tkinter) that communicates with the network using a PCAN adapter.
• Built separate behavior profiles for each EV with proprietary CAN signals.
• Used Pi GPIO and MOSFETs soldered to a perfboard to switch fused 12v ignition and emergency stop lines on and off.
• Built a custom-harness terminated in a 47-pin deutsch-style connector.

Low-Noise Two-Stage Dual-Channel Headphone Amplifier | May 2024

• Designed battery-powered amplifier optimized for high impedance headphones.
• Achieved 18Hz-25kHz 3db small-signal bandwidth using high and low pass filters.
• Simulated circuit in HSPICE for low-noise and high-power output.
• Powered amplifier with two 9v batteries and reduced high-frequency noise using capacitors in the supply lines.
• Implemented and tested the design on a perfboard.

RNN Stock Prediction | May 2024

• Imported 2021-2022 S&P 500 time series stock price data with sentiment data from SNES 1.0 dataset.
• Performed exploratory data analysis with Matplotlib and Seaborn and preprocessed data using Pandas and Scikit-Learn.
• Built five-layer LSTM RNN with Keras to predict day-on-day percentage change.
• Simulated investment portfolio using a directional trading strategy.
• Concluded the model was unsuccessful due to stock market unpredictability.

Proportional Integral DC Motor Controller in C | November 2023

• Established hardware connections between the Explorer 16/32 Board, H-bridge, and motor components, configuring pins for encoder inputs, motor control signals, and power supply.
• Programmed motor controller with on/off, proportional, and proportional-integral modes.
• Tracked motor angle with a two-bit state machine and controlled it with output compare.
• Printed angle values to LCD and graphed motor angle via Matlab using UART for communication.

Three-Axis Stepper Motor Stage Controller in C++ | May 2023

• Programmed C++ library to control a three-axis stepper motor stage via UART over RS-232 port.
• Wrote functions to open a serial port, establish a serial connection, and read/write with error detection.

Battleship in C++ | December 2022

• Developed a responsive console-based user interface with input validation, graphical grid rendering, and dynamic feedback for hits and misses.
• Implemented intricate game mechanics, such as ship abilities, hit tracking, and win conditions.

NBA Shot Outcome Prediction with Machine Learning | December 2022

• Conducted data analysis and feature engineering on NBA shot data using Python.
• Implemented Logistic Regression, Decision Tree, Random Forest, and CNN models to predict outcomes.
